result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacinda K. Lekfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: defendant's notice of judgment - moved- unable to forward
revoked
defendant's notice of cert -not deliverable as addressed - no mail receptacle

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: notified Amy @ ONSO - cancelled by Br 2

2:44 p.m. Defendant Jacinda K. Lekfield in court with attorney Richard John Shawl. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel in receipt of revocation summary. Shawl speaks to correction--p. 2, adjustment under supervision--did not lose job/left for factory work. Schiek/Shawl/Lekfield statement to sentencing--defendant release date for Lincoln Co. case scheduled for February. Court statement. Court quashes warrant. 

Court sentence
9 mos. county jail each count concurrent; concurrent to Lincoln County case - may serve in any county w/Huber
186 days' credit
Costs to civil judgment
Appeal rights
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Per Public Defender's office, Ms. Lekfield has not contacted their office for appointment so no atty at this time. Sentencing after revocation hearing set for 1/6/2017 @ 02:30 p.m. (Notice of hearing and copy of rev packet sent to Deft at Lincoln Co Jail)
- includes cover letter and revoction summary
per Mary @ ONSO - detainer - Lincoln County
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

Defendant Jacinda K. Lekfield in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:51
State moves to amend  both counts to 4th degree SA  -940.225(3m) - Granted - Plea questionnaire filed- No contest plea to both counts as amended -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Bednar- Provides Victim Impact Statement /Snyder/Court statement to sentencing - 
Court WHS and POP For 2 years- each CC
CC/CV/DNAAS($686) -  to be paid directly to clerk of Courts(-Payment Plan paperwork given and  to be in by 4-18 )/Supervision fees-- Comply with any conditions on any Childrens court and disopositional orders and Chpt 51 orders currently in place.  Comply with all sex offender rules provided and continue any treatment/counseling currently in as deemed appropriate by PO-  Sumbit DNA sample - Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO  Court will grant expunction under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and all $$ paid 
   The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). 
Appeal right given -  Need further action scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:00 am.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 03-09-2016 02:00 pm

1:47 p.m. Defendant Jacinda K. Lekfield in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Snyder statement -close to resolution - needs to provide additional documentation to DA's office. Snyder motion to modify bond. Michlig statement to motion. Court statement - Court modifies bond to allow natural father to arrange day care or suitable babysitter other than mother. Bail continued. Adj. 1:51 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:39 p.m. Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Snyder states defendant is in hospital having emergency surgery - Court directs Snyder to obtain paperwork from hospital regarding Defendant's admission to hospital. Bail continued. Adj. 3:41 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacinda K. Lekfield
Current: N9648 Cross Rd, Tomahawk, WI 54487 United States  (Effective: 10-14-2015)
Prior: 6520 N. Railway Street, Irma, WI 54442
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

1:31 p.m. Defendant Jacinda K. Lekfield in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Prelim time limits waived.
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Bond signed on 9-3-15 prior to court appearance
Defendant's infant child not to be left in care of anyone but mother or natural father.

1:22 p.m. Defendant Jacinda K. Lekfield in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Vorhees in appearance - Defendant qualifies for counsel. Bail continued with same conditions as original bond. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:15 pm. Adj. 1:24 p.m.
